topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/535cab616368723519030300#post_535cab616368723519030300
What is with purple eyes and their media portrayal of being 'mysterious'?
topics.author: 4fde5cee945b700a970060fc

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/535cac556368726519900200#post_535cac556368726519900200

Precisely because they are rare, they're supposed to represent the person as special.

Extract from TVTropes:

_...and in fiction generally mean that a character is very special, rare, unique, and/or somehow possessed of strange or mysterious talents or heritage. These connotations mean that it's mostly possessed by characters that are either key to the plot, or need to stand out from the background. It is also a popular Mary Sue eye color for the same reasons._

_Albinos in fiction are also likely to have these, though being albino is generally special in its own way as the condition is quite rare. They are possible in real life in people with pigmentation deficiencies. The lack of pigment in the irises creates a translucent blue color through which the underlying blood vessels are visible; the combination of the blue eyes with the red blood creates a purplish tint to the iris._
